{{for|the Czech orienteer|Michal Horáček (orienteer)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox politician |name = Michal Horáček |image = Michal Horáček 2016.jpg |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1952|7|23}} |birth_place = [[Prague]], [[Czechoslovakia]]
{{small|(now [[Czech Republic]])}} |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Independent politician|Independent]] |spouse = {{marriage|Rut Horáčková|1976|2010}} {{marriage|Michaela Hořejši|2012}} [https://www.lidovky.cz/vazim-si-na-nem-hlavne-velkorysosti-budu-za-nim-stat-rika-manzelka-michala-horacka-michaela-g85-/lide.aspx?c=A180105_175939_lide_ele] |children = 3 |relatives = [[Jaroslav Heyrovský]] {{small|(great-uncle)}} |signature = Signature-horacek.jpg |website = {{url|michalhoracek.cz|michalhoracek.cz}} }} '''Michal Horáček''' (born 23 July 1952) is a [[Czech Republic|Czech]] entrepreneur, lyricist, poet, writer, journalist and music producer. From 2007 until 2010, he was the chairman of the [[Czech Academy of Popular Music]].{{cite web|url=http://www.financnici.cz/michal-horacek|title=Michal Horáček: Textař, podnikatel, novinář|work=Financnici|at=financnici.cz|accessdate=19 January 2012|language=cs}}{{cite web|url=http://redakce.scena.cz/index.php?d=3&page=nethovory&id_n=616&full=1|title=Michal Horáček|work=Scena.cz|at=scena.cz|accessdate=19 January 2012|language=cs}} He founded Czech betting company Fortuna.{{Cite news|url=http://zpravy.e15.cz/horacek-kandidat-prezidentske-volby-2018|title=Michal Horáček - kandidát v prezidentských volbách 2018 - E15.cz|work=Zprávy E15.cz|access-date=2017-12-19}} He stood to become [[President of the Czech Republic|Czech president]] in the 2018 presidential election, but came in 4th in the first round, failing to advance. ==2018 presidential election== In April 2016, Horáček announced his possible candidacy in the [[Czech presidential election, 2018|2018 Czech presidential election]].{{cite web|title=Zvažuji kandidaturu na prezidenta, Zeman volby znovu nevyhraje, říká Michal Horáček|url=http://video.aktualne.cz/dvtv/zeman-znovu-volby-nevyhraje-kandidaturu-na-prezidenta-vazne/r~48f3fd940d7311e682380025900fea04/|website=Aktuálně.TV - Jen to, co musíte vidět|accessdate=27 June 2016}} Horáček announced his candidacy on 7 October 2016.{{cite web|title=Horáček se chystá na volbu prezidenta. Už je to na víc než 99 procent|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/horacek-volba-prezidenta-vic-nez-99-procent-fj3-/domaci.aspx?c=A161007_193212_domaci_kop|website=iDNES.cz|accessdate=7 May 2017|date=7 October 2016}} He officially launched his campaign on 3 November 2016.{{cite web|title=Nástupce Zemana? Horáček bude kandidovat|url=http://www.tyden.cz/rubriky/domaci/politika/nastupce-zemana-horacek-bude-kandidovat_404188.html?showTab=nejctenejsi-7|website=TÝDEN.cz|accessdate=7 May 2017|date=3 November 2016}} He said that he wanted his campaign to be based on respect for all people and their opinions.{{cite web|title=Horáček: Jsem mnohem lepší než Schwarzenberg, umím jazyky. On nepochopil, co udělal špatně|url=https://zpravy.aktualne.cz/domaci/horacek-jsem-ve-vsem-lepsi-nez-schwarzenberg-nepochopil/r~7b042cdec48c11e690ca002590604f2e/?redirected=1494169455|website=Aktuálně.cz - Víte co se právě děje|accessdate=7 May 2017|language=cs-CZ|date=17 December 2016}} Horáček announced his advisers on 9 February 2017, including former Slovak presidential candidate [[Magdaléna Vášáryová]], nuclear energy safety expert [[Dana Drábová]], and surgeon Pavel Pafko.{{cite web|title=Kandidát na prezidenta Horáček představil tým dvanácti poradců. Jsou v něm Drábová, Vášáryová i cyklista König|url=http://domaci.ihned.cz/c1-65618620-kandidat-na-prezidenta-horacek-predstavil-tym-dvanacti-poradcu-jsou-v-nem-drabova-vasaryova-i-cyklista-konig|website=Hospodářské noviny|accessdate=7 May 2017|language=cs-CZ|date=9 February 2017}} In 16 April 2017, Horáček started gathering the 50,000 signatures required for participation in the election.{{cite web|title=Horáček začal sbírat podpisy pro prezidentskou volbu. Favoritem nejsem, říká|url=https://www.novinky.cz/domaci/435224-horacek-zacal-sbirat-podpisy-pro-prezidentskou-volbu-favoritem-nejsem-rika.html|website=Novinky.cz|accessdate=7 May 2017|language=cs-CZ}} On 6 May he reported that he had gathered the required number of signatures.{{cite web|title=50 tisíc podpisů pro kandidaturu. Horáček má zřejmě hotovo|url=https://www.denik.cz/z_domova/horacek-hlasi-hotovo-pry-uz-ma-padesat-tisic-podpisu-20170506.html|website=Deník CZ|accessdate=27 October 2017}} Horáček finished fourth of the nine candidates, with 9.18% of the vote.{{cite web|title=Výsledky Michala Horáčka|url=https://volby.idnes.cz/prezidentske-volby-2018.aspx?k=vysledky-prvni-kolo&t=8&o=2&kandidat=michal-horacek|website=idnes.cz|accessdate=18 January 2018|language=cs-CZ}} Horáček then endorsed [[Jiří Drahoš]] for the second round.{{cite web|title=Drahoš ukončil kontaktní kampaň. U voličů se za něj budou přimlouvat Horáček, Hilšer i Fischer|url=https://www.irozhlas.cz/volby/prezidentske-volby-2018-jiri-drahos-v-lucerne_1801222007_ako|website=irozhlas.cz|accessdate=25 January 2018|date=22 January 2018}} ==Political views== Horáček once said that "left-wing thinking isn't thinking",{{cite web|title=Horáček: Listopad 89? Zábavný pohřeb|url=http://revue.idnes.cz/horacek-listopad-89-zabavny-pohreb-dlb-/lidicky.aspx?c=2004MM45A04B|website=iDNES.cz|accessdate=26 May 2017|date=11 November 2004}} but later said that he had changed his mind and started to consider it more seriously.{{cite web|title=Horáček chce být prezidentem, přesvědčí chudé a zklamané?|url=https://zpravy.tiscali.cz/horacek-chce-byt-prezidentem-presvedci-chude-a-zklamane-288463|website=Tiscali.cz|accessdate=26 May 2017|language=cs}} He describes himself as neither left-wing nor right-wing,{{cite web|last1=generator|first1=metatags|title=Michal Horáček - Program|url=https://www.michalhoracek.cz/proc-kandiduji/program/|website=Michal Horáček|accessdate=26 May 2017|language=cs-CZ}} but his platform for the 2018 presidential election was described by political scientists as left-wing.{{cite web|title=Exkluzivně: Zeman nemá nic jisté, Drahoš i Horáček s ním svádí těsný souboj|url=https://www.seznam.cz/zpravy/clanek/exkluzivni-pruzkum-rodi-se-souper-pro-zemana-ale-bude-to-tesne-30619|website=www.seznam.cz|accessdate=26 May 2017}} He supports [[European Union]] membership but would not oppose a referendum about leaving it.{{cite web|last1=Průcha|first1=Jaroslav|title=Michal Horáček: EU musí přežít, alespoň tvrdé jádro|url=http://roklen24.cz/a/wj8SJ/michal-horacek-eu-musi-prezit-alespon-tvrde-jadro|website=Roklen24.cz|accessdate=26 May 2017|language=cs-CZ}}{{cite web|title=Horáček jde na ruku Zemanovým voličům. Neodmítl referendum o EU|url=http://forum24.cz/horacek-jde-na-ruku-zemanovym-volicum-neodmitl-referendum-o-setrvani-v-eu/|accessdate=26 May 2017|language=cs-CZ}} Horáček stated in July 2016 that opposing immigration was "like opposing rain", and added that Czechs have historically helped immigrants.{{cite web|title=Nechtít uprchlíky je jako nechtít déšť? Možný prezidentský kandidát Horáček se zděsil|url=http://domaci.eurozpravy.cz/spolecnost/161360-nechtit-uprchliky-je-jako-nechtit-dest-mozny-prezidentsky-kandidat-horacek-se-zdesil/|website=EuroZprávy.cz|accessdate=26 May 2017|language=en}}{{cite web|title=Horáček: Odpůrce migrace je jako odpůrce deště. Pomozme těm, co ctí naše pravidla|url=http://www.blesk.cz/clanek/zpravy-politika/405198/horacek-odpurce-migrace-je-jako-odpurce-deste-pomozme-tem-kdo-cti-nas-rad.html|website=Blesk.cz|accessdate=26 May 2017}} He has expressed opposition to migration quotas and to accepting large numbers of refugees, saying that the Czech Republic should not accept immigrants that Czechs do not want to accept.{{cite news|last1=Brožová|first1=Karolína|title=Vládu s komunisty bych nedovolil, říká Michal Horáček|url=https://www.novinky.cz/domaci/420452-vladu-s-komunisty-bych-nedovolil-rika-michal-horacek.html|accessdate=27 October 2017|work=Novinky.cz|date=12 November 2016}}{{cite web|title=Našli jsme vyjádření Michala Horáčka k uprchlíkům|url=http://www.parlamentnilisty.cz/arena/monitor/Nasli-jsme-vyjadreni-Michala-Horacka-k-uprchlikum-479313|website=Parlamentní Listy|accessdate=26 May 2017}} ==Personal life== Horáček is a Roman Catholic.[http://forum24.cz/modlitba-za-nemocneho-zemana-byla-treba-tvrdi-michal-horacek/ forum24.cz][http://praguemonitor.com/2017/12/28/few-presidential-candidates-support-homosexual-adoptions praguemonitor.com] ==Discography== ;Studio albums *1987: ''Potměšilý host'' with [[Hana Hegerová]] & [[Petr Hapka]] *1988: ''V penziónu Svět'' with Petr Hapka *1996: ''Citová investice'' with Petr Hapka *2000: ''Richard Müller a hosté'' with [[Richard Müller (singer)|Richard Müller]] & [[Jan Saudek]]'' *2001: ''Mohlo by tu být i líp'' with Petr Hapka *2003: ''[[Tak to chodí]]'' with Jarda Svoboda *2006: ''[[Strážce plamene]]'' with Petr Hapka *2008: ''[[Ohrožený druh]]'' *2009: ''Kudykam'' with Petr Hapka *2011: ''[[Tante Cose da Veder]]'' with Petr Hapka & [[Ondřej Brzobohatý]] *2012: ''[[O lásce, cti a kuráži]]'' *2012: ''[[Michal Horáček Tribute]]'' *2013: ''[[Český kalendář]]'' ==Bibliography== *1983: ''Království za koně'', Olympia *1984: ''Zpráva z Kentucky'', Turf klub SSM *1990: ''Jak pukaly ledy'', Ex libris *1996: ''Los a sázka'', Fortuna *2002: ''Kdo víc vsadí, ten víc bere'' with Ladislav Verecký, Nakladatelství [[Lidové noviny]] *2004: ''O české krvi otců vlasti'', Nakladatelství Lidové noviny *2007: ''O tajemství královny krav'', Nakladatelství Lidové noviny *2009: ''Kudykam'', Nakladatelství Lidové noviny *2012: ''Český kalendář'', Nakladatelství Lidové noviny *2012: ''Habitus hazardního hráče'', Nakladatelství Lidové noviny ==Awards== {| class="wikitable" |- !width="1"|Year !width="152"|Award !width="86"|Result |- |1982 |Awards of World Press Institute |{{won}} |} ==References== {{Commons category|Michal Horáček}} {{reflist|colwidth=45em}} == External links == * [http://michalhoracek.cz/ Michal Horáček] (official website) {{Candidates in the Czech presidential election, 2018}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Horacek, Michal}} [[Category:1952 births]] [[Category:Czech businesspeople]] [[Category:Czech journalists]] [[Category:Czech philanthropists]] [[Category:Czech politicians]] [[Category:Czech presidential candidates, 2018]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Writers from Prague]] [[Category:Czech Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Czech male poets]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Abu Omar | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = Mohammed Mohiedin Anis | birth_date = {{birth based on age as of date |70|2017|03|15}}<ref name="jalopnik1" /> | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = Syrian | religion = | ethnicity = | residence = Aleppo, Syria | education = | alma mater = | occupation = Businessman | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | known for = Car collection | boards = | salary = | networth = | spouse = | parents = | children = | relations = | website = }} [[File:47 Caddy convertible.jpg|thumb|A 1947 Cadillac convertible (all the cars shown are representative examples, and not from his actual collection)]] [[File:1957 Mercury Montclair 2 door Hardtop (17896059486).jpg|thumb|A 1957 Mercury Montclair]] [[File:Buick Super 56R 1955.jpg|thumb|A 1955 Buick Super]] [[File:1949 Hudson Commodore 6 four-door at 2015 AACA Eastern Regional Fall Meet 03of10.jpg|thumb|A 1949 Hudson Commodore]] [[File:1958 Chevrolet Apache (13404499473).jpg|thumb|A 1958 Chevrolet Apache]] [[File:My Rusty VW thing.jpg|thumb|A VW Thing]]
'''Mohammed Mohiedin Anis''' (born 1946/47), also known as '''Abu Omar''', is a Syrian businessman and car collector, based in [[Aleppo]]. A March 2017 photograph of him sitting on his bed, smoking a pipe and listening to his wind-up record player in a rubble-strewn room has been widely reproduced.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://time.com/4701247/aleppo-syria-car-collector/ |author=Katz, Andrew|title=The Man on the Bed |website=Time.com |date=14 March 2017 |accessdate=15 March 2017}}</ref>
==Early life== Anis studied medicine in [[Zaragoza]], Spain, in the 1970s.<ref name="washingtonpost1">{{cite news|last=Selk |first=Avi |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2017/03/14/how-one-mans-pause-became-a-haunting-symbol-of-aleppos-destruction/ |title=How one man’s pause became a haunting symbol of Aleppo’s destruction |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date=14 March 2017 |accessdate=15 March 2017}}</ref><ref name="DiarioMotor">{{cite news|last1=Álvarez|first1=Sergio|title=A pesar de la destrucción del conflicto, este coleccionista de clásicos de Alepo no ha perdido su pasión|url=http://www.diariomotor.com/noticia/coches-clasicos-siria/|accessdate=15 March 2017|work=DiarioMotor|date=15 March 2017}}</ref> His father was a wealthy textile dye entrepreneur.<ref name=laalo>[http://laalo.net/aleppo-car-lover-aims-to-revive-his-wounded-classics-world/ "Aleppo automotive lover goals to revive his ´wounded´ classics | World"], Laalo.net.</ref>
==Career== In the 1970s, he was employed in Italy translating [[Fiat]] car manuals into Arabic.<ref name="jalopnik1"/><ref name="DiarioMotor" /> Later he went back to Syria and opened a cosmetics factory called "Mila Robinson".<ref name="jalopnik1"/><ref name="washingtonpost1"/><ref name="DiarioMotor" /><ref name=laalo />
==Car collection== Anis states that his fascination with classic cars goes back to the 1950 Pontiac that his father drove, and which Anis still owns.<ref name="jalopnik1">{{cite web|url=http://jalopnik.com/syrian-car-enthusiasts-30-car-collection-destroyed-in-c-1793278047 |author= Westbrook, Justin T.| title=Syrian Enthusiast's 30-Car Collection Destroyed In Civil War |website=Jalopnik.com |date=14 March 2017|accessdate=15 March 2017}}</ref>
His first purchase was a 1947 Plymouth.<ref name="autogenerated1"/> His collection now includes dozens of cars from the 1940s and 1950s, and prior to the [[Syrian Civil War]], he had hoped to open a museum in Syria.<ref name="autogenerated1"/> His favourite among his collection is a 1947 Cadillac convertible, now badly damaged, that he bought in a 2005 auction.<ref name="jalopnik1"/> He maintains that "no car collection is complete without at least one Cadillac",<ref name="jalopnik1"/> and his collection also includes a [[VW Thing]], a 1955 [[Buick Super]], a 1949 [[Hudson Commodore]], a 1957 [[Mercury Montclair]], a 1958 [[Chevrolet Apache]], a cargo-van bodied [[Citroen 2CV]], a 1947 Plymouth, as well as other vintage Buicks and Cadillacs.<ref name="jalopnik1"/>
Anis's collection of classic cars reached some 30 vehicles, but has slowly dwindled during the war.<ref name="independentcivil">{{cite news|author=McKernan, Bethan |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/aleppo-viral-photograph-old-man-story-behind-syria-civil-war-six-years-mohammed-moheidin-anis-abu-a7630691.html |title=Aleppo man: The story behind the viral photograph symbolising six years of Syrian civil war |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |date=15 March 2017|accessdate=15 March 2017}}</ref> In January 2016, he had 24 vintage cars, having lost six to shelling.<ref name="autogenerated2">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-35387895 |title=Syrian vintage car collector Abu Omar defies shelling – BBC News |website=Bbc.co.uk |date=23 January 2017 |accessdate=15 March 2017}}</ref> To prevent theft of the cars, he removes the steering wheels and seats. During the conflict, his neighbours stopped rebels who wanted to mount an anti-aircraft gun on a 1958 Chevrolet.<ref name="jalopnik1"/>
He had to leave Aleppo for a time at the height of the [[Battle of Aleppo (2012–16)|Battle of Aleppo]], and when he returned only 13 cars were left (including his 1947 Cadillac convertible, now badly damaged), seven having been impounded by the Syrian police, and 10 either missing or destroyed in the war.<ref name="jalopnik1"/> In March 2017, Anis estimated that altogether, one-third of the collection had been either destroyed or stolen.<ref name="independentcivil"/> He says, "When one of my cars is hit, it's as if I or one of my relatives has been hit. It's as if they were my children, so I come down to check on them".<ref name="jalopnik1" />
==Personal life== Anis lives alone in the formerly rebel-held neighbourhood of al-Shaar in [[Aleppo]], his family having fled due to the war.<ref name="autogenerated2"/> He has eight children with two wives, one in Aleppo, the other in [[Hama]], and would like to leave his cars to his children, two to every boy, one to every girl.<ref name="jalopnik1"/><ref name=laalo /> He speaks five languages, and likes to smoke a pipe while listening to classical music, and to Syrian singers such as [[Mohamed Dia al-Din]].<ref name="washingtonpost1"/><ref name="independentcivil"/>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== * [http://www.gettyimages.co.uk/event/vintage-cars-amidst-the-ruins-of-aleppo-548260839 Slide show of his cars]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Anis, Mohammed Mohiedin}} [[Category:1940s births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Car collectors]] [[Category:Year of birth uncertain]] [[Category:Syrian businesspeople]] [[Category:20th-century businesspeople]] [[Category:21st-century businesspeople]]

{{EngvarB|date=June 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Sir Naim Dangoor | spouse = Renée Dangoor <small>(1947–2008)</small> | children = [[David Dangoor]] and three other sons | image = Naim_Dangoor.jpg | alt = | caption = Naim Dangoor (left) with his friend Ahmed Safwat in 1940s | birth_name = | birth_date = April 1914 | birth_place = [[Baghdad]], [[Ottoman Empire]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2015|11|19|1914|4|1|df=yes}} | death_place = [[London]], United Kingdom | nationality = British | other_names = | occupation = Businessman | known_for = Philanthropy | alma_mater = [[University of London]] | parents = Eliahou Dangoor | relatives = [[Ezra Dangoor|Hakham Ezra Reuben Dangoor]] (grandfather) }} '''Sir Naim Eliahou Dangoor''', [[CBE]] (April 1914 – 19 November 2015) was a British-naturalised Iraqi-born Jewish entrepreneur and philanthropist.
==Early life == He was born in [[Baghdad]] in April 1914, the second of six siblings. His father Eliahou Dangoor (1883–1976) was the world's largest printer of Arabic books,<ref name=Millman>{{cite news|last1=Millman|first1=Joel|title=Iraq's forgotten exiles seek redress|url= https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/jul/05/iraq.theeditorpressreview|work=The Guardian|accessdate=11 June 2014|date=5 July 2003}}</ref> and his grandfather [[Ezra Dangoor|Hakham Ezra Reuben Dangoor]] was the [[Chief Rabbi]] of Baghdad.<ref>{{Cite news|title = Iraq's forgotten exiles seek redress|url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/jul/05/iraq.theeditorpressreview|work = [[The Guardian]]|accessdate = 24 September 2015|first = Joel|last = Millman}}</ref>
In the 1930s, Dangoor made the five-day journey from Baghdad to London, at the age of 17, in order to enroll in an engineering degree at the [[University of London]].<ref name= IPD>{{Cite web|title = Two Centenarians: Iraq’s First Coke Bottler Shares a Birth Year With the Coca-Cola Bottle|url = https://www.einnews.com/pr_news/260467001/two-centenarians-iraq-s-first-coke-bottler-shares-a-birth-year-with-the-coca-cola-bottle|accessdate = 20 November 2015|author = Jamal Booker}}</ref> After graduating he returned to Iraq where he was conscripted into the army and became an officer. It was during his army training that he met his future business partner Ahmed Safwat.<ref name= IPD/>
==Career == Initially on leaving the army he had hoped to become an engineer on the railways, but due to restrictions imposed upon Jews this was not possible, so he and Ahmed, a Muslim, decided to go into business together, setting up Eastern Industries in 1949.
Their first contract was to supply new windows to all Iraqi government buildings, and soon their portfolio grew to include property development and letting.<ref>{{cite web|title = Funding education runs in their family |url = http://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/131565/funding-education-runs-their-family|work= [[The Jewish Chronicle]]|date = 12 March 2015|accessdate = 24 September 2015}}</ref> In 1950, Eastern industries secured the first contract to bottle [[Coca-Cola]] in Iraq.<ref>{{cite web|title = Two Centenarians: Iraq’s First Coke Bottler Shares a Birth Year With the Coca-Cola Bottle|url = https://www.einnews.com/pr_news/260467001/two-centenarians-iraq-s-first-coke-bottler-shares-a-birth-year-with-the-coca-cola-bottle|accessdate = 24 September 2015|first = IPD|last = Group}}</ref> Alongside Eastern Industries, Dangoor also ran factories producing matches and furniture.
With the founding of the State of Israel and the resulting conflict between Israel and the Arab states, the situation for Jews in the country worsened and in 1959 Dangoor took the difficult decision to take his family out. He continued travelling back and forth for business until 1963, when he decided that the worsening political situation made it too risky for him to return. As a result of laws specific to Jews, he lost his Iraqi citizenship, and his property and business interests were taken by the government.<ref name="promises">{{cite news|last1 = Curtis|first1 = Polly|title = Keeping promises|url = https://www.theguardian.com/education/2004/nov/26/accesstouniversity.highereducation|work = [[The Guardian]]|accessdate = 11 June 2014|date = 26 November 2004}}</ref> He was eventually permitted to settle in the UK where he set about rebuilding his life, setting up a property business that his four sons went on to join.<ref name="University">{{cite web|title = Dr Naim Dangoor|url = http://www.le.ac.uk/ebulletin-archive/ebulletin/news/press-releases/2000-2009/2009/12/portal_factory/NPArticle/nparticle.2009-12-08.0519426930/index.html|publisher = [[University of Leicester]]|accessdate = 11 June 2014}}</ref>
==Personal life==
In November 1947, Dangoor married his cousin,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/12031574/Sir-Naim-Dangoor-businessman-obituary.html|title=Sir Naim Dangoor, businessman - obituary|date=2015-12-03|access-date=2017-12-16|language=en-GB|issn=0307-1235}}</ref> Renée Dangoor (who had been crowned [[Miss Iraq]] earlier that year).<ref>{{Cite web|title = Dangoor family donates £1.1m to Cancer Research UK|url = http://www.fundraising.co.uk/2010/08/02/dangoor-family-donates-11m-cancer-research-uk/|website = UK Fundraising|accessdate = 24 September 2015}}</ref> They went on to have four sons.
==Philanthropy == In order to preserve the heritage of the community he had left behind, soon after settling in the UK, he founded a community centre in West [[Kensington]] for new Iraqi Jewish immigrants, and in 1971 began editing and publishing ''The Scribe – Journal of Babylonian Jewry'', with 4000 subscribers in 25 countries which continued to be published for 35 years.<ref name="University" /><ref>{{Cite web|title = The Scribe – Journal of Babylonian Jewry|url = http://www.dangoor.com/scribe.html|website = www.dangoor.com|accessdate = 24 September 2015}}</ref>
In 1970 he revived the title of [[Exilarch]] – an ancient title held by the supreme leader of all the Jewish communities in Babylonia, up until the 13th Century.<ref>{{Cite web|title = EXILARCH – Encyclopaedia Iranica|url = http://www.iranicaonline.org/articles/exilarch|website = www.iranicaonline.org|accessdate = 24 September 2015|last = electricpulp.com}}</ref>
In 2003 he demanded £12 billion ($20 billion) from Iraq's leaders as compensation for what the Iraqi-Jewish community had lost in Iraq after the [[Second World War]].<ref name=Guardian>{{cite web|last1=Millman|first1=Joel|title=Iraq's forgotten exiles seek redress|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/jul/05/iraq.theeditorpressreview|work=The Guardian|accessdate=11 June 2014|date=5 July 2003}}</ref>
As his business in the UK grew, he wanted to give back to the country that had taken him in. In 1980 he set up the Exilarch's Foundation, a charity that has made numerous donations to causes relating to education and health.<ref name = "Funding">{{Cite news|title = Funding education runs in their family |url = http://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/131565/funding-education-runs-their-family|author= Charlotte Oliver|work = [[The Jewish Chronicle]]|accessdate = 24 September 2015}}</ref>
In 2004 he created the Dangoor Scholarships to help one thousand undergraduate students who had no family history of further education, at the 1994 Group of universities.<ref name = "Funding"/>
A few years later in 2009 he created the Eliahou Dangoor Scholarships, in honour of his father. These were awarded to four thousand undergraduate students, with limited means, studying STEM (science, technology, engineering and maths) subjects.<ref name = "Funding"/>
In the same year Dangoor was made honorary President for the Association of Jewish Academics from Iraq.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://iraqijews.awardspace.com/books.html?|title = Association for Jewish Academics from Iraq|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>
The Exilarch's Foundation also sponsors the Westminster Academy in West London, whose pupils hail from over 60 countries, many in the Middle East. Dangoor's family have been closely involved with the running of the school and have seen it go from being issued with an Ofsted 'Notice to Improve' in 2009, to being rated as 'Outstanding' in 2013.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Ofsted {{!}} Westminster Academy|url = http://reports.ofsted.gov.uk/inspection-reports/find-inspection-report/provider/ELS/131262|website = reports.ofsted.gov.uk|accessdate = 24 September 2015}}</ref> Since the Academy opened the number of students achieving five A*-C GCSE grades including both English and Maths has increased from 17% to 70% in 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://westminsteracademy.net/documents/September2010.pdf|title = Westminster Academy Documents|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Ofsted School Data Dashboard for Westminster Academy|url = http://dashboard.ofsted.gov.uk/dash.php?urn=131262|website = dashboard.ofsted.gov.uk|accessdate = 24 September 2015}}</ref>
Dangoor also donated a significant amount to [[Cancer Research UK]] to support their website, in memory of his late wife Renée, who died from breast cancer in 2008.<ref>{{cite web|title=Funding and Partners|url=http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/cancer-help/utilities/about-cancerhelp-uk/funding-and-partners|publisher=[[Cancer Research UK]]|accessdate=11 June 2014}}</ref>
At [[Bar-Ilan University]] in Israel, Dangoor set up the Dangoor Centre for Personalised Medicine in the [[Galilee]], which partners with hospitals to analyse the genetic makeup of individual patients, enabling doctors to implement the most effective treatments.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Bar-Ilan University and the British Friends of Bar-Ilan proudly announce the establishment of the Dangoor Center for Personalised Medicine at the University's School of Medicine in the Galilee – British Friends of Bar-Ilan|url = http://www.bfbiu.org/healthcare/bar-ilan-university-british-friends-bar-ilan-proudly-announce-establishment-dangoor-center-personalised-medicine-universitys-school-medicine-galilee/|accessdate = 2015-09-24}}</ref>
In 2014 he made the largest gift to the Royal Society of Medicine in its history. The donation is being used to help support young people from disadvantaged backgrounds who would like to pursue a career in medicine, as well as supporting the society's post-graduate education provision.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Royal Society of Medicine celebrates £2m donation from Naim Dangoor – RSM press release|url = https://www.rsm.ac.uk/about-us/media-information/2014-media-releases/royal-society-of-medicine-celebrates-2m-donation-from-naim-dangoor.aspx|website = www.rsm.ac.uk|accessdate = 2015-09-24}}</ref>
Dangoor was also the largest private individual donor to the [[Francis Crick Institute]] in London, Europe's largest biomedical research centre.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Europe's superlab: Sir Paul's cathedral|url = http://www.nature.com/news/europe-s-superlab-sir-paul-s-cathedral-1.17827|accessdate = 2015-09-24}}</ref>
Dangoor Walk, a pathway that runs beside the Francis Crick Institute and links Midland Road with Ossulton Street, is named after him.
Through his foundation Dangoor promoted the idea of 'Universal Monotheism' a concept that he believes can bring about unity and create a framework for a global religious ethic. He has sponsored the setting up of a [http://www.monotheism-biu.org/ centre for Universal Monotheism at Bar-Ilan University] from which he received an honorary doctorate in 2006.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Bar Ilan University {{!}} Honorary Doctorate Recipients|url = http://www1.biu.ac.il/indexE.php?id=982&pt=1&pid=35&level=3&cPath=35|website = www1.biu.ac.il|accessdate = 2015-09-24}}</ref>
He made contributions to the [[University of Nanjing]] in China, and had a particular interest in China because his late wife Renée was born and grew up in [[Shanghai]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Which country has 10 Jewish study centres? (And it's not obvious) {{!}} The Jewish Chronicle|url = http://www.thejc.com/news/world-news/52356/which-country-has-10-jewish-study-centres-and-its-not-obvious|website = www.thejc.com|accessdate = 2015-09-24}}</ref> In Nanjing he funded scholarships for the university's Jewish Studies Institute and sponsored an international symposium on monotheism, attended by delegates from all over China, the US, Australia and Israel. In 2011 he was made a consultant professor of the University of Nanjing in recognition of his contributions.
==Honours ==
He received an [[OBE]] in 2006, a [[CBE]] in the 2012 New Year's Honours List, and was made a [[Knight Bachelor]] in the Queen's 2015 birthday honours list.<ref>{{cite news|title = Jewish philanthropists, scientists and artists honoured on New Year List|url = http://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/61218/jewish-philanthropists-scientists-and-artists-honoured-new-year-list|work=[[The Jewish Chronicle]]|accessdate = 24 September 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title = Queen's birthday honours: Here's the full list|url = http://metro.co.uk/2015/06/13/queens-birthday-honours-heres-the-full-list-5243692/|work = [[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|accessdate = 24 September 2015|author = Amy Willis }}</ref> He became the second-oldest person to be knighted, and the oldest to be knighted for the first time – [[Robert Mayer (philanthropist)|Robert Mayer]] was 101 when he was made a Knight Commander of the [[Royal Victorian Order]], but he had already been made a Knight Bachelor at the age of 60.
In 2012 Dangoor was made a fellow of [[Birkbeck College]], part of the [[University of London]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Birkbeck welcomes new Fellows — Birkbeck, University of London|url = http://www.bbk.ac.uk/news/birkbeck-welcomes-new-fellows|website = www.bbk.ac.uk|accessdate = 2015-09-24}}</ref> This was in addition to his honorary fellowship of the Royal Albert Hall of Arts and Sciences, awarded in 2007.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Current supporters — Royal Albert Hall|url = http://www.royalalberthall.com/support/supporters/|website = Royal Albert Hall|accessdate = 2015-09-24}}</ref>
In April 2015, to mark his birthday, Coca-Cola published a piece on the first Coca-Cola bottler of Iraq sharing a centenary with the iconic Coca-Cola bottle.<ref>http://www.coca-colacompany.com/cokebottle100/two-centenarians-iraqs-first-coke-bottler-shares-a-birth-year-with-the-coca-cola-bottle</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
{{authority control}}

{{Multiple issues| {{refimprove|date=February 2008}} {{inappropriate tone|date=February 2008}} }}
'''Place management''' is the process of making places better. This is practiced through programmes to improve a location or to maintain an already attained desired standard of operation. Place management can be undertaken by private, public or voluntary organisations or a mixture of each. Despite the wide variety of place management initiatives the underlying common factor is usually a desire to maximise the effectiveness of a location for its users, whether they are residents, shoppers, tourists, investors, property developers or business owners.
== Overview == Place management is defined by the Institute of Place Management as "a coordinated, area-based, multi-stakeholder approach to improve locations, harnessing the skills, experiences and resources of those in the private, public and voluntary sectors".<ref name=IPM>{{cite web|title=Institute of Place Management Website|url=http://www.placemanagement.org/}}</ref> However, as a conceptual field it remains relatively underdeveloped because of its infancy.
== History == Place management has its roots in the [[management]] of towns, cities, neighbourhoods and other locations. The reasons for the need for place management are compelling. The proportion of the world’s population living in cities has grown from 13% in 1900 to nearly 50% now.<ref name="Grimond">{{cite journal|last=Grimond|first=J. |title=The World goes to town|journal=The Economist|date=May 3, 2007}}</ref> Changes particularly in healthcare and technology have led to dramatic shifts in migration practices. Fluctuations in the movement of people places a strain on both urban and rural locations.
Migration is not limited between rural and urban locations but can also happen between countries, creating issues relating to cultural integration. People will migrate for numerous reasons often linked with finding a better quality of life either through superior employment prospects, escaping war or poverty, or even to enjoy a better climate. This can create problems for locations which become exposed to increases in population, decreases in population, or a shift in the demographic composition of a population. Places subsequently act as focal points for the occurrence of phenomena such as [[globalisation]] and the [[clash of civilisations]].
Factors such as changing technology not only drive migration, but can in themselves trouble the prosperity of places. Technological development was a driver behind the [[Industrial Revolution]] which led to high levels of migration into urban locations. However, further technological development rendered many of the primary functions of successful industrial cities as obsolete towards the end of the twentieth century. Grimond cites [[New York City]] as being one city which “went through a bad patch in the 1970s” while other major cities, such as [[Manchester]] in the UK which is famed for instigating the Industrial Revolution, also suffered.<ref name="Grimond"/> Rapid technological and industrial change not only creates jobs but can also cause mass unemployment, damaging local economies and leaving pockets of deprivation across regions.
Another important factor in the development of the field of place management is the impact of the retail sector. As a non-judicial parliamentary review of the UK retail sector states, retailing is a necessity for local populations, supplying food and goods in the absence of self agricultural practices. However, shifts in the sector influenced by national and multi-national companies have led to the globalisation of the sector, which raises concerns about the sustainability of the supply of goods and the effectiveness of local economies. Furthermore, all business practices, either positively or negatively, can impact upon the prosperity of the area it is based through the employment of people, investment and skills retention.
As it now appears to be accepted that for numerous reasons places undergo a process evolution which can impact upon their prosperity, it has become more widely acknowledged that deliberate and co-ordinated intervention in this evolution is desirable. Recognising a symbiotic relationship between the prosperity of a location and the prosperity of retail, firms Boots the Chemist, J Sainsburys and Marks & Spencer in the UK contributed to the development of place management by supporting local authorities in the formation of locally based intervention schemes.<ref>[http://www.atcm.org/about/what-is-tcm.php Association of Town Centre Management Website]</ref> This led to the appointments of the [[United Kingdom]]'s first town centre managers in [[Ilford]] and the London Borough of Redbridge in 1987. This consequently led to the formation of the Association of Town Centre Management.<ref>Warnaby, G., Alexander, A., Medway, D. (1998), "Town centre management in the UK: a review, synthesis and research agenda", [[The International Review of Retail Distribution and Consumer Research]], Vol. 8 No.1, pp.15-31</ref> Between 1987 and 2000 around 500 town centre management schemes covering 600 towns and cities dedicated to co-ordinating various functions of a particular location have been established.
Since the 1970s and 1980s, similar intervention schemes were practiced elsewhere under different guises including urban revitalisation in Poland, activity centre management in Australia, and business improvement districts in the US. Despite their differences, as they each embody the aim of improving the effectiveness of a location, the Institute of Place Management has sought to unify them under the banner of ‘place management’ borrowing a term which was originally conceived in Australia.
== Nature == Place management has existed for over 20 years in a variety of forms. It is encompassed within the practice of acts including town centre management, urban revitalisation, activity centre management, regeneration, management, marketing, economic development, neighbourhood management, neighbourhood renewal, socio-economic revitalisation, community development and business improvement district management.<ref>Parker, C. 2008. "Extended editorial: place - the trinal frontier" Journal of Place Management and Development, Vol 1 No. 1, pp 5-14</ref> However, there exist questions about the practical nature of place management because no clear consensus has yet been developed.
Questions include both the positive and normative aspects of place management. The overwhelming amount of variables which impact upon the effectiveness of a location in serving the needs of its users makes it difficult to determine if place management is being practised in a particular location, how it is being practiced and how it should be practiced. A mixture of cultural, societal, demographic, economic, religious, political, legal and technological issues may all play a role. This is problematic for both the academic and the practical determination of place management.
Although this term is relatively new, place management has, in practice, become an established concept over the last twenty years in Europe, having existed in parts of North America for much longer. It is also an emerging concept in other parts of the world such as Asia and Australia. The concept embraces management of a wide range of locations, which may include public and private spaces of various sizes and geographical spaces. Consequently, place management can take a number of forms. Initiatives can be differentiated by the origins of the resources which support it and the degree of formality which underpins the agreement to secure resources from the various funding bodies.
One example is a community-based (bottom-up) approach, where communities or businesses take the initiative of improving their street, town centre, public park or engage actively with NGOs and the voluntary sector. Among many other examples, this approach has been trialled successfully since 1995 by an association of independent retailers in Granollers, Spain where a not-for-profit association was formed which aimed to enhance the local area for residents and consumers, investing revenue in improvements and charitable causes.<ref>Coca-Stefaniak J.A., Parker C., Barbany A., Garrell X. and Segovia E. (2005), Gran Centre Granollers city, culture and commerce, [[The International Review of Retail Distribution and Consumer Research]], Vol.33 No.9</ref> This demonstrates an informal place management initiative.
A [[business improvement district]] (BID) is a predominantly private partnership (although it can also encompass some public resources) in which businesses in a defined area elect to pay an additional tax in order to fund improvements to the district's public realm and trading environment. These businesses hope to see a return on their investment through an increase in customer spend within the location. The concept of the BID is believed to have been developed in Canada before spreading to the US and across the globe. Unlike the Granollers example, as a BID is a formal place management initiative because it acts as an additional tax which is legally recognised in many of the areas in which they have been set up.
Contrary to the ‘bottom-up’ approach, many place management schemes have been initially formed publicly by local government, which has provided funding to create the post of a place manager. Local government is often seen as a natural home for place management initiatives, as its remit will be to obtain a desired standard of living for its residents. However, the additional financial burden or a lack of place management expertise can hamper efforts to locate place management initiatives with local government.
==References== {{reflist}}

{{italic title}} {{refimprove|date=June 2017}}
'''''Public Speaking and Influencing Men In Business''''' ({{ISBN|0-7661-6973-1}}) is a [[public speaking]] book written by [[Dale Carnegie]] in 1937 and first published in 1926 as ''Public Speaking: a Practical Course for Business Men'', with several revised editions published later. Dorothy Carnegie produced 2 separate revised editions: ''How to Develop Self-Confidence and Influence People by Public Speaking'' (1956), aimed at the general public, and ''The Quick and Easy Way to Effective Speaking'' (1962), as a replacement textbook for the Dale Carnegie Course. A more recent revised edition is ''Public Speaking for Success'' (2005), revised by Arthur Pell, which restores content that was left out of the Dorothy Carnegie-revised works.
''Public Speaking: a Practical Course for Business Men'', ''Public Speaking and Influencing Men In Business'', and ''The Quick and Easy Way to Effective Speaking'' served as standard textbooks in the Dale Carnegie Course.
The main focus of this book is to present a thorough understanding of the principles of public speaking, as well as guidance into conquering the fears attributed to public speaking.
==Contents== # Developing Courage and Self Confidence # Self-Confidence thru Preparation # How Famous Speakers Prepared Their Addresses # The Improvement of Memory # Keeping the Audience Awake # Essential Elements in Successful Speaking # The Secret of Good Delivery # Platform Presence and Personality # How to Open a Talk # Capturing Your Audience at Once # How to Close a Talk # How to Make your Meaning Clear # How to Be Impressive and Convincing # How to Interest your Audience # How to Get Action # Improving your Diction
Appendices: * ''[[Acres of Diamond]]'' by [[Russell Conwell]] * ''[[A Message to Garcia]]'' by [[Elbert Hubbard]] * ''[[As a Man Thinketh]]'' by [[James Allen (author)|James Allen]]
[[Category:1926 books]] [[Category:Business books]] [[Category:Public speaking]] [[Category:Books by Dale Carnegie]]

[[File:Rollbonding.png|thumb|Schematic drawing of the roll bonding process]] '''Roll bonding''' is a solid state, [[cold welding]] process, obtained through [[Rolling (metalworking)|flat rolling]] of [[sheet metal]]s. In roll bonding, two or more layers of different metals are passed through a pair of flat rollers under sufficient pressure to bond the layers. The pressure is high enough to deform the metals and reduce the combined thickness of the clad material. The mating surfaces must be previously prepared (scratched, cleaned, degreased) in order to increase their friction coefficient and remove any oxide layers. The process can be performed at room temperature<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Bay|first1=N.|last2=Clemensen|first2=C.|last3=Juelstorp|first3=O.|last4=Wanheim|first4=T.|title=Bond Strength in Cold Roll Bonding|journal=CIRP Annals - Manufacturing Technology|date=January 1985|volume=34|issue=1|pages=221–224|doi=10.1016/S0007-8506(07)61760-0}}</ref> or at warm conditions. In warm roll bonding, heat is applied to pre-heat the sheets just before rolling, in order to increase their [[ductility]] and improve the strength of the weld. The strength of the rolled bonds depends on the main process parameters, including the rolling conditions (entry temperature of the sheets, amount of thickness reduction, rolling speed, etc.), the pre-rolling treatment conditions (annealing temperature and time, surface preparation techniques, etc.) and the post-rolling heat treatments.
==Applications==
The applications of roll bonding can be used for [[Cladding_(metalworking)|cladding]] of metal sheets, or as a sub-step of the [[accumulative roll bonding]]. Bonding of the sheets can be controlled by painting a pattern on one sheet; only the bare metal surfaces bond, and the un-bonded portion can be inflated if the sheet is heated and the coating vaporizes. This is used to make [[heat exchanger]]s for refrigeration equipment. <ref name=BRALLA07>Bralla, James G. ''Handbook of Manufacturing Processes'' Industrial Press 2007 {{ISBN|978-0-8311-3179-1}} pages 310-312 </ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=December 2012}} {{no footnotes|date=April 2016}} }}
{{Infobox company | name = SalesLoft | logo = [[File:SalesLoft Logo.png]] | logo_size = 100px | type = [[Private Company|Private]] | industry = [[Sales Engagement]] | foundation = 2011 | founder = Kyle Porter, Rob Forman, Tim Dorr, and David Cummings | location_city = [[Atlanta, Georgia]] | locations = | area_served = | key_people = Kyle Porter, Rob Forman, Tim Dorr, David Cummings and Tom Noonan | products = Sales Engagement Platform | location_country = [[United States|U.S.]] }}
SalesLoft is the leading sales engagement platform, helping sales organizations to deliver a better sales experience for their customers. The company was founded in September 2011<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=235728284|title=Company Overview of SalesLoft|last=|first=|date=2018-08-17|website=www.bloomberg.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-17}}</ref>. Though its original product offering focused on sales development, the company has since expanded its platform to offer functionality for the entire [[sales]] organization<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/salesloft-kyle-porter-interview-2017-1|title=This startup killed its most profitable product because customers were using it for evil — now it's worth $100 million|work=Business Insider|access-date=2018-08-17}}</ref>.
==History== The company's founders, Kyle Porter and David Cummings, met at Georgia Tech’s Advanced Technology Development Center and incorporated SalesLoft in September 2011. Shortly thereafter, SalesLoft graduated from renowned startup accelerator, [[Techstars|TechStars]], in [[Boulder, Colorado]]. The company moved into its new offices in The [[Atlanta Tech Village]] in [[Buckhead|Buckhead, Atlanta]]. The company continued to grow quickly, surpassing the 100 employee mark in early 2016. The company relocated to its new office in [[Regions Plaza (Atlanta, Georgia)|Regions Plaza]] in [[Midtown Atlanta]] in August 2017<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/news/2017/02/03/salesloft-moving-hq-to-midtown-adding-250-jobs.html|title=https://www.bizjournals.com/atlanta/news/2017/02/03/salesloft-moving-hq-to-midtown-adding-250-jobs.html|website=www.bizjournals.com|access-date=2018-08-17}}</ref>.
More than 2,000 customers use the company’s category-leading sales engagement platform to engage in more relevant, authentic, and sincere ways, including Square, MuleSoft, Alteryx, and Dell.
Based in Atlanta, Georgia, with additional offices in San Francisco and New York, SalesLoft has more than 300 employees and was recognized as the #1 best place to work in Atlanta.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ajc.com/business/growing-software-firm-built-core-values/Xjnm3EnCNe4Cub0JNbPOZL/|title=SalesLoft: Top Midsize Workplace|work=ajc|access-date=2018-08-21}}</ref>. The company was also named the 7th Fastest-Growing Technology Company in North America by Deloitte.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/technology-media-and-telecommunications/articles/fast500-winners-press-release.html|title=2017 North America Technology Fast 500 winners – Press Release {{!}} Deloitte US|website=Deloitte United States|language=en|access-date=2018-08-21}}</ref>.
== Leadership == Kyle Porter, Founder and CEO
Rob Forman, Co-founder and COO
Christine Kaszubski, CHRO
Sydney Sloan, CMO
Sean Murray, CRO
Scott Mitchell, CTO
2018
* Acquired North Carolina startup Noteninja for an undisclosed amount.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://martechseries.com/sales-marketing/sales-intelligence/salesloft-acquires-noteninja-transform-sales-meeting-intelligence/|title=SalesLoft Acquires Noteninja to Bring AI-based Sales Meeting Intelligence|website=martechseries.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-11}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://hypepotamus.com/news/salesloft-noteninja-acquisition/|title=SalesLoft Acquires North Carolina Meeting Intelligence Startup - Hypepotamus|date=2018-05-22|work=Hypepotamus|access-date=2018-06-11|language=en-US}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}6. {{refbegin|35em}} * [https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1309&dat=20001004&id=-1RIAAAAIBAJ&sjid=lhQEAAAAIBAJ&pg=5337,1018505&hl=en New Straits Times<!-- Bot generated title -->] * [https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2479&dat=20000519&id=ilg1AAAAIBAJ&sjid=gSUMAAAAIBAJ&pg=2121,9374950&hl=en Philippine Daily Inquirer<!-- Bot generated title -->] * [http://www.inc.com/encyclopedia/young-entrepreneurs-organization-yeo.html "Young Entrepreneurs' Organization (YEO)"]. ''[[Inc. (magazine)|Inc.]]''. * [https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1683&dat=20031112&id=GMQcAAAAIBAJ&sjid=t44EAAAAIBAJ&pg=6484,781461&hl=en Milwaukee Journal Sentinel<!-- Bot generated title -->] * [http://articles.latimes.com/1992-04-12/news/vw-407_1_young-entrepreneurs Oh, to Be So Young, Ambitious and Really Really Rich<!-- Bot generated title -->]. {{Expert-subject|Psychology|date=October 2008}}
'''VALS''' ("Values and Lifestyles")<ref>{{cite web|title=Vals Definition by SRI|url=https://www.sri.com/sites/default/timeline/timeline.php?timeline=business-entertainment#!&innovation=vals-market-research}}</ref> is a proprietary research methodology used for [[psychographic]] [[market segmentation]]. VALS is a way of viewing people on the basis of their attitudes, needs, wants, beliefs and demographics. By using psychology to analyze and predict consumer preferences and choices, the VALS system constructs a link between personality traits and buying behavior.The system identifies current and future opportunities by segmenting the consumer market place on the basis of the personality traits that drive consumer behavior<ref>Raj, Mohan, M. Prasanna, and A. K. Sait. "Psychographic Profiling of Indian Young Adult Consumers of Smartphone-VALS Approach." Management Studies and Economic Systems 2, no. 2 (2015): 95-102.</ref>
==History and description== VALS was developed in 1978 by social scientist and consumer futurist [[Arnold Mitchell]] and his colleagues at [[SRI International]]. It was immediately embraced by advertising agencies and is currently offered as a product of SRI's consulting services division. VALS draws heavily on the work of Harvard sociologist [[David Riesman]] and psychologist [[Abraham Maslow]].<ref name=HBR>{{cite journal|last=Yankelovich|first=Daniel|title=Rediscovering Market Segmentation|author2=David Meer |journal=Harvard Business Review|date=February 6, 2006|pages=1–11|url=http://www.viewpointlearning.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/segmentation_0206.pdf|accessdate=7 June 2011}}</ref>
Mitchell used statistics to identify attitudinal and [[demographic]] questions that helped categorize adult American consumers into one of nine lifestyle types: survivors (4%), sustainers (7%), belongers (35%), emulators (9%), achievers (22%), I-am-me (5%), experiential (7%), societally conscious (9%), and integrated (2%). The questions were weighted using data developed from a sample of 1,635 Americans and their [[significant other]]s, who responded to an SRI International survey in 1980.<ref name=ACR>{{cite journal|last=Beatty|first=Sharon E.|author2=Pamela M. Homer |author3=Lynn R. Kahle |title=Problems With Vals in International Marketing Research: an Example From an Application of the Empirical Mirror Technique|journal=Advances in Consumer Research|year=1988|volume=15|pages=375–380|url=http://www.acrwebsite.org/volumes/display.asp?id=6655|accessdate=7 June 2011}}</ref>
The main dimensions of the VALS framework are resources (the [[Y-axis|vertical dimension]]) and primary motivation (the [[X-axis|horizontal dimension]]). The vertical dimension segments people based on the degree to which they are [[innovative]] and have resources such as [[income]], [[education]], [[self-confidence]], [[intelligence]], leadership skills, and energy. The horizontal dimension represents primary motivations and includes three distinct types:
* Consumers driven by [[knowledge]] and [[Value (personal and cultural)|principles]] are motivated primarily by ''[[Ideal (ethics)|ideals]]''. These consumers include groups called Thinkers and Believers. * Consumers driven by demonstrating success to their peers are motivated primarily by ''achievement''. These consumers include groups referred to as Achievers and Strivers. * Consumers driven by a desire for [[social]] or [[physical activity]], variety, and risk taking are motivated primarily by ''self-expression''. These consumers include the groups known as Experiencers and Makers.
At the top of the rectangle are the [[Innovator]]s, who have such high resources that they could have any of the three primary motivations. At the bottom of the rectangle are the Survivors, who live complacently and within their means without a strong primary motivation of the types listed above. The VALS Framework gives more details about each of the groups.
==VALS2== Researchers faced some problems with the VALS method, and in response, SRI developed the VALS2 programme in 1978; additionally, SRI significantly revised it in 1989. VALS2 places less emphasis on activities and interests and more on a psychological base to tap relatively enduring attitudes and values. The VALS2 program has two dimensions. The first dimension, Self-orientation, determines the type of goals and behaviours that individuals will pursue, and refers to patterns of attitudes and activities which help individuals reinforce, sustain, or modify their social self-image. This is a fundamental human need.
The second dimension, Resources, reflects the ability of individuals to pursue their dominant self-orientation and includes full-range of physical, psychological, demographic, and material means such as self-confidence, interpersonal skills, inventiveness, intelligence, eagerness to buy, money, position, education, etc. According to VALS 2, a consumer purchases certain products and services because the individual is a specific type of person. The purchase is believed to reflect a consumer’s lifestyle, which is a function of self–orientation and resources.
In 1991, the name VALS2 was switched back to VALS, because of [[brand equity]]. <ref>{{cite web|title=VALS™ Survey Help|url=http://ww.strategicbusinessinsights.com/vals/help.shtml#12}}</ref>
==Criticisms== [[Psychographic]] segmentation has been criticized by well-known public opinion analyst and social scientist [[Daniel Yankelovich]], who says psychographics are "very weak" at predicting people's purchases, making it a "very poor" tool for corporate decision-makers.<ref name=HBR />
The VALS Framework has also been criticized as too culturally specific for international use.<ref name=ACR />
==VALS Framework and Segment==
The following types correspond to VALS segments of US adults based on two concepts for understanding consumers: primary motivation and resources.<ref>{{cite web|title=US Framework and VALS™ Types|url=http://www.strategicbusinessinsights.com/vals/ustypes.shtml}}</ref>
*'''''Innovators.''''' These consumers are on the leading edge of change, have the highest incomes, and such high self-esteem and abundant resources that they can indulge in any or all self-orientations. They are located above the rectangle. Image is important to them as an expression of taste, [[independence]], and [[Persona|character]]. Their consumer choices are directed toward the "finer things in life." *'''''Thinkers.''''' These consumers are the high-resource group of those who are motivated by ideals. They are mature, responsible, well-educated professionals. Their [[leisure]] activities center on their homes, but they are well informed about what goes on in the world and are open to new ideas and [[social change]]. They have high incomes but are practical consumers and rational decision makers. *'''''Believers.''''' These consumers are the low-resource group of those who are motivated by ideals. They are [[conservative]] and predictable consumers who favor local products and established brands. Their lives are centered on [[family]], [[community]], and the nation. They have modest incomes. *'''''Achievers.''''' These consumers are the high-resource group of those who are motivated by achievement. They are successful work-oriented people who get their satisfaction from their jobs and families. They are [[politically conservative]] and respect authority and the status quo. They favor established products and services that show off their success to their peers. *'''''Strivers.''''' These consumers are the low-resource group of those who are motivated by achievements. They have values very similar to achievers but have fewer economic, social, and psychological resources. Style is extremely important to them as they strive to emulate people they admire. *'''''Experiencers.''''' These consumers are the high-resource group of those who are motivated by self-expression. They are the youngest of all the segments, with a median age of 25. They have a lot of energy, which they pour into [[physical exercise]] and social activities. They are avid consumers, spending heavily on clothing, fast-foods, music, and other youthful favorites, with particular emphasis on new products and services. *'''''Makers.''''' These consumers are the low-resource group of those who are motivated by self-expression. They are practical people who value self-sufficiency. They are focused on the familiar - family, [[employment|work]], and physical recreation - and have little interest in the broader world. As consumers, they appreciate practical and functional products. *'''''Survivors.''''' These consumers have the lowest incomes. They have too few resources to be included in any consumer self-orientation and are thus located below the rectangle. They are the oldest of all the segments, with a median age of 61. Within their limited means, they tend to be brand-loyal consumers.
===Use of the VALS Framework=== There is little to no evidence of the use of this framework on a wide basis by any other industry other than the ad industry as indicated by SRI on what little it shares on its website (go to the SRI website for more info).
==See also== *[[Advertising]] *[[Data mining]] *[[Demographics]] *[[Fear, uncertainty, and doubt]] *[[Marketing]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==Further reading== *{{cite book|title=Mass Communication: Living in a Media World|author=Hanson, Ralph E. |date= 2011}} *{{cite news|title=Consumer Lifestyles: A Social Stratification Perspective|authors=Lawson, Rob Lawson & Todd, Sarah |work=Marketing Theory |date=2002|volume= 2|page= 295}} *{{cite book|author=Olson, Peter|title=Consumer Behavior and Marketing Strategy|date= 2005}}
==External links== *[http://www.strategicbusinessinsights.com/ Strategic Business Insights Official website] (was formerly SRI Consulting Business Intelligence)
{{DEFAULTSORT:Vals}} [[Category:Market research]] [[Category:Market segmentation]] [[Category:Psychometrics]] [[Category:Social research]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2012}} [[Image:Wcoty.png|thumb|right|World Car of the Year logo]] The '''World Car Awards''' (WCOTY) ({{lang-fr|link=no|Prix mondial de la Voiture de l'année}}) is an automobile award selected by a jury of 82 international automotive journalists from 24 countries. Cars considered must be sold in at least five countries, on at least two continents prior to 1 January of the year of the award. The contest was inaugurated in 2003, and officially launched in January 2004.
This was as a unified award, similar to many of the continent, and nation-specific [[Car of the Year]] awards already given.<ref>http://www.wcoty.com/media/?release=53&year=2010</ref> Since 2006, awards for performance, green cars, and car design have also been given.<ref>[http://www.wcoty.com/2007/ wcoty.com World Car of the Year Awards]</ref> In 2013, an award for luxury design was inaugurated.
==History== [[File:World Car Awards @ New York Autoshow (8598830580).jpg|thumb|[[Volkswagen Golf Mk7|Volkswagen Golf VII]] is the 2013 World Car of the Year]] [[File:World Car Awards @ New York Autoshow (8598825096).jpg|thumb|[[Porsche Boxster#981|Porsche Boxster]] is the 2013 World Performance Car]] ;2005 :Ten finalists were reduced to three, before the winner was selected at the [[Canadian International AutoShow]] in Toronto. The [[Audi A6]], [[Porsche 911]], and [[Volvo S40]]/[[Volvo V50|V50]] were the top three finalists.
;2006 :For 2006, in addition to the WCOTY award, the performance, green, and design categories were added; the award was announced at the [[New York International Auto Show]]. The [[BMW 3 Series]], [[Mazda MX-5 (NC)|Mazda MX-5]], and [[Porsche Cayman]] were the top three finalists.
;2007 :The [[Lexus LS]], [[Mini Hatch|MINI]], and [[Audi TT]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2008 :The [[Mazda2]] / Demio, [[Ford Mondeo]], and [[Mercedes-Benz C-Class]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2009 :The [[Volkswagen Golf]], [[Ford Fiesta]], and [[Toyota iQ]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2010 :The [[Volkswagen Polo]], [[Mercedes-Benz E-Class]], and [[Audi A5]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2011 :The [[Nissan Leaf]], [[Audi A8]], and [[BMW 5 Series]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2012 :The [[Volkswagen Up|Volkswagen up!]], [[BMW 3 Series]], and [[Porsche 911]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2013 :The Volkswagen Golf, [[Mercedes-Benz A-Class#W176|Mercedes-Benz A-Class]], [[Porsche Boxster]] and [[Toyota 86|Subaru BRZ/Toyota GT-86]] were the top four finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2014 :The [[Audi A3]], [[Mazda3]] and [[BMW 4 Series]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2015 :The [[Mercedes-Benz C-Class]], [[Volkswagen Passat]] and [[Ford Mustang]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2016 :The [[Mazda MX-5 (ND)|Mazda MX-5]], [[Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class|Mercedes-Benz GLC]] and [[Audi A4#B9|Audi A4]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2017 :The [[Jaguar F-PACE]], [[Volkswagen_Tiguan#Second_generation|Volkswagen Tiguan]] and [[Audi_Q5#Second_Generation|Audi Q5]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.
;2018 :The [[Volvo_XC60#Second_generation_(2017–present)|Volvo XC60]], [[Range Rover Velar]] and [[Mazda_CX-5#Second_generation_(KF;_2017–present)|Mazda CX-5]] were the top three finalists. The winner was announced at the New York International Auto Show.

{{Infobox award | name = Wright Brothers Medal | image = Wright bros medal.png | imagesize = 220px | caption = | description = Contributions to aerospace engineering | presenter = [[SAE International|SAE]] | country = {{USA}} | year = 1927 | website = http://www.sae.org/news/awards/list/wright/ }}
The '''Wright Brothers Medal''' was conceived of in 1924 by the Dayton Section of the [[Society of Automotive Engineers]], and the SAE established it in 1927 to recognize individuals who have made notable contributions in the engineering, design, development, or operation of air and space vehicles. The award is based on contributed research papers.<ref name=Significant>{{cite book|title=Significant American and international awards in aviation|author=United States. Navy Dept. Bureau of Aeronautics|year=1954|pages=91–92|url=http://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?seq=11&view=image&size=100&id=mdp.39015018432529&u=1&num=91}}</ref><ref name=ahp>{{cite book|title=Awards, Honors, and Prizes|author=Wasserman, P.|year=1975|page=363|volume=1|publisher=Gale Company|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=AnhMAAAAYAAJ&dq=%22wright%20brothers%20medal%22%20-langley&source=gbs_similarbooks}}</ref><ref name=nrc>{{cite book|title=Bulletin of the National Research Council|author=National Academy of Sciences|year=1934|page=116|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QWwbAAAAMAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+-langley&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+-langley&hl=en&ei=7WUGTYOnAs2TnwevhozlDQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CDAQ6AEwAzhQ}}</ref>
The award honors [[Wright Brothers|Wilbur and Orville Wright]] as the first successful builders of heavier-than-air craft, and includes an image of the ''[[Wright Flyer]]'', the plane which they flew in 1903 at [[Kitty Hawk, North Carolina]].
==Awardees and research topics: 1928-1975== *1928 [[Clinton Hunter Havill]] - ''Aircraft Propellers''.<ref name=Significant/><ref name=havill_1>{{cite journal|year=1929|title=Announcements|page=63|volume=2|journal=Aviation Engineering|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ecA7AAAAMAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+warner&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+warner&hl=en&ei=yvYITfnXHI-gnQfxyZ0O&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CEIQ6AEwBw}}</ref> *1929 [[Ralph Hazlett Upson]] - ''Wings - A Coordinated System of Basic Design''.<ref name=upson_1>{{cite journal|year=1931|title=Some Fundamental Economics of Aircraft Operation|page=175|volume=52|journal=ASME Transactions|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=f_I6AAAAMAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+upson&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+upson&hl=en&ei=6U0JTZWKCYS0lQfsr-ygAQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CEIQ6AEwBw}}</ref><ref name=upson_2>{{cite book|title=Hearings|author=United States Congress. Senate Committee on Naval Affairs|year=1936|page=257|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=K5egmS7oSX0C&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+upson&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+upson&hl=en&ei=6U0JTZWKCYS0lQfsr-ygAQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=book-thumbnail&resnum=10&ved=0CEsQ6wEwCQ}}</ref> *1930 [[Theodore Paul Wright]] - ''The Development of a Safe Airplane - The Curtis Tanager''.<ref name=wright_1>{{cite book|title=Pioneering in aeronautics: Recipients of the Daniel Guggenheim Medal, 1929-1952|author=Daniel Guggenheim Medal Board of Award|year=1952|page=103|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=5xInAAAAMAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+tanager&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+tanager&hl=en&ei=MogKTdL3HY7ZnAeh5oz9Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDIQ6AEwAg}}</ref> *1931 [[Stephen Joseph Zand]]: ''A Study of Airplane and Instrument Board Vibration''<ref name=zand_1>{{cite book|title=Courage and innovation: the story of LORD Corporation, 1924 to 2002|author=Kholos, L.|year=2005|page=51|publisher=Albrecht & Associates|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=AR97AHnpLNgC&pg=PT65&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+zand&hl=en&ei=6UwJTdGrK4W0lQekxZm2AQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CDIQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=%22wright%20brothers%20medal%22%20zand&f=false}}</ref> *1932 [[Edward Pearson Warner]]: ''The Rational Specifications of Airplane Load Factors''<ref name=warner_1>{{cite journal|year=1952|title=Dr. Warner, ICAO Council Pres., to Get Wright Trophy|page=65|volume=31-35|journal=National Aeronautics|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=4YIPAAAAIAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+warner&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+warner&hl=en&ei=yvYITfnXHI-gnQfxyZ0O&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=9&ved=0CEUQ6AEwCA}}</ref><ref name=warner_2>{{cite book|title=Pioneering in aeronautics: Recipients of the Daniel Guggenheim Medal, 1929-1952|author=Daniel Guggenheim Medal Board of Award|year=1952|page=126|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=optBAAAAIAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+warner&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+warner&hl=en&ei=G_sITbaUN4-lngeC3MX6Dw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CDEQ6AEwAzgK}}</ref> *1933 [[Eastman Nixon Jacobs]]: ''The Aerodynamics of Wing Sections for Airplanes''<ref name=jacobs_1>{{cite journal|year=1934|title=Jacobs' Paper Discussion Develops Additional Points Worth Studying|page=226|volume=29|journal=SAE Transactions|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EGDmAAAAMAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+jacobs&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+jacobs&hl=en&ei=kvQITbPcIpOsnAehpamGDw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDAQ6AEwAg}}</ref><ref name=jacobs_2>{{cite journal|year=1937|title=1937 Winner: Eastman Jacobs Gets Sylvanus Albert Reed Award|page=80|volume=1|journal=American Aviation|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=FwMnAAAAMAAJ&q=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+jacobs&dq=%22wright+brothers+medal%22+jacobs&hl=en&ei=kvQITbPcIpOsnAehpamGDw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBw}}</ref> Macatangay, Dr Herbert Mosebach, Paul D Mudgett, Henrik Schumann-Olsen, Wolfgang Supper, and Gijsbert Tan: ''Evaluation of ANITA Air Monitoring on the International Space Station'' *2010 Henrik Kihlman, and Magnus Engström: ''Flexapods - Flexible Tooling at SAAB for Building the NEURON Aircraft'' *2011 Matthew Barker, Luke Hickson, [https://www.linkedin.com/profile/public-profile-settings?trk=prof-edit-edit-public_profile Joeseph K-W Lam], Stephen Paul Tomlinson, and Darran Venn: ''[http://papers.sae.org/2011-01-2540/ Mathematical Model of Water Contamination in Aircraft Fuel Tanks]'' *2012 Jerry Bieszczad, Michael Izenson, George Ford Kiwada, Patrick J Magari: ''Ultra- Compact Power System for Long-Endurance Small Unmanned Aerial Systems'' *2013 [[Ing Rafael Fernandes de Oliveira]] *2014 [[Troy Beechner]], [[Kyle Ian Merical]], [[Paul Yelvington]]
